In addition, women who enter pregnancy overweight or obese will often remain so throughout pregnancy, 
with an increased risk of glucose intolerance during gestation. Therefore, it is difficult to separate the impact 
of exposure to preconceptual obesity versus exposure during any other subsequent stage of pregnancy, or 
the impact of different degrees of GWG. To date, few studies have investigated the stage-specific effects
